dataset_fields.label: API name
dataset_fields.form_placeholder: e.g. Suomi.fi Finnish Service Catalogue API
dataset_fields.description: Give a short and descriptive name for the API. For example, Turku geospatial API (WFS)
dataset_fields.group_post_description: Instructions on how to add APIs

dataset_fields.label: API description
dataset_fields.description:
Describe:
  • What kind of data is available through the API?
  • How can the API be used?
  • How can you get access to the API?
  • Where can you find more information about the API?

dataset_fields.label: Keywords
dataset_fields.description: Select at least one keyword relating to your data that helps users to find your API.

dataset_fields.label: API visibility on opendata.fi
dataset_fields.description: You can set the visibility to private temporarily, for example if the API is still missing some information. Private APIs can only be viewed by the members of the organisation that provides the API.

dataset_fields.label: License for the data provided by the API
dataset_fields.description: Select how the data that is available through the API is licensed. Use a CC BY 4 license if you want your organisation to be credited when someone uses your data. Use a CC0 license if you want to give up all copyright.

dataset_fields.label: API access rights
dataset_fields.form_placeholder: E.g. a link to the terms of service
dataset_fields.description:
Describe the possible restrictions in the use of the API and the pricing. For example, who can access the API, does the API require an API key, and where can users find it. 
 Provide a link to the terms of service and to the possible service-level agreement (SLA) of the API.

dataset_fields.label: API maintainer
dataset_fields.description: Give the name of the organisation or department that is responsible for maintaining the API.
dataset_fields.group_title: Provider and maintainer of the API collection

dataset_fields.label: API maintainer email
dataset_fields.description: Enter the email address of the organisation's customer service, not an email address of an individual.

dataset_fields.label: API publisher
dataset_fields.description: Select the organisation that provides the API.

resource_fields.label: Resource name
resource_fields.form_placeholder: e.g. Finnish Service Catalogue OpenAPI description
resource_fields.description: Give the resource a descriptive name. For example, Turku geospatial API OpenAPI description

resource_fields.label: URL
resource_fields.upload_label: Link to an API endpoint or API documentation
resource_fields.group_description: Add a link to an API endpoint or API documentation, for example OpenAPI. You can also add more information about the API as a pdf-file.

resource_fields.label: Technical API description
resource_fields.form_placeholder: Write a technical description for the API.
resource_fields.description:
Describe:
  • What kind of data the API returns?
  • Which version of the API is in use?
  • Where can you find the technical documentation for the API?

resource_fields.label: Does the API require registration?
resource_fields.description: If your API requires registration, describe the registration process in the Description field.
